Name: MOZILLA_FIREFOX_LOCKED_CUSTOM_HOMEPAGE
Explaining Text: Allows the customization of the homepage. You can choose to blank the home page or set a custom URL.
Label: Display when Firefox starts

Name: MOZILLA_FIREFOX_LOCKED_CUSTOM_HOMEPAGE
Explaining Text: Allows the customization of the homepage. You can choose to blank the home page or set a custom URL.
Label: Custom Homepage

Name: MOZILLA_FIREFOX_LOCKED_CUSTOM_USERAGENT
Explaining Text: Allows the customization of the useragent. This overrides the entire useragent sent to the server.
Label: Custom UserAgent

Name: MOZILLA_FIREFOX_LOCKED_NTLM_TRUSTED_URIS
Explaining Text: Comma-seperated list of FQDNs to allow NTLM authentication.
Label: URIs

Name: MOZILLA_FIREFOX_LOCKED_DISABLE_DM
Explaining Text: Disables the Download Manager from appearing when you start to download a file.
Label: Disable Search Engine Updates

Name: MOZILLA_FIREFOX_LOCKED_SUPRESSUPDATEPAGE
Explaining Text:
After updating Firefox, by default it display's a "What's New" page.

If you enable this policy, that page will be supressed.
Label: Disable Search Engine Updates

Name: MOZILLA_FIREFOX_LOCKED_DISABLEADDONWIZARD
Explaining Text: Disables the Add-On Wizard at startup.
Label: Disable Search Engine Updates

Name: MOZILLA_FIREFOX_LOCKED_DISABLETELEMETRY
Explaining Text: Disables prompt and disables sending data to Mozilla. Disabling this will enable Telemetry.
Label: Disable Search Engine Updates

Name: MOZILLA_FIREFOX_LOCKED_DISABLERIGHTS
Explaining Text: Disables the "Know your rights..." prompt on first run.
Label: Disable Search Engine Updates

Name: MOZILLA_FIREFOX_LOCKED_PROXYSETTINGS
Label: Proxy Mode
Possible Values:
Listitems: 
     "" = "No proxy" 
     "" = "Manual proxy configuration" 
     "" = "Use auto configuration URL (PAC)" 
     "" = "Autodetect network configuration" 
     "" = "Use system configuration"

Name: MOZILLA_FIREFOX_LOCKED_PROXYSETTINGS
Label: Use HTTP Proxy for all protocols
